item.title: Expressing support for designation of June 10th as "National Pipeline Safety Day".

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6398-6400; text as passed Senate: CR S6400; text of measure as introduced: CR S6475)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6398-6400; text as passed Senate: CR S6400; text of measure as introduced: CR S6475)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6398-6399)

summary.text: Designates June 10, 2009, as National Pipeline Safety Day.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Designates June 10, 2009, as National Pipeline Safety Day.

Encourages: (1) pipeline safety stakeholders to use the day to create greater public awareness of advancements that can lead to greater pipeline safety; and (2) individuals throughout the United States to become aware of pipelines that run through their communities and encourage safe gas and hazardous liquid pipeline practices and damage prevention.

bill.title: A resolution designating June 10, 2009, as "National Pipeline Safety Day".

item.title: A resolution designating June 10, 2009, as "National Pipeline Safety Day".
A resolution designating June 10, 2009, as "National Pipeline Safety Day".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
